channel.title: What's a 508?
channel.description: Just wondering the difference between a 508 server and a regular one. And if there was anything special needed to run a 508 server. Thanks, and yea it might sound like a nooby question (and it probably is) but I was just wondering :)

item.title: What's a 508?
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Dvs Chick:

Thanks. And sheesh I was just being nice and obviously you boys don’t like that. Mmmmmk whatevs. Thanks I guess.

No, its against the rules to talk about Rep. And 508 is the version number of the client that most people are using for new age servers. 317 is the version number of the ‘normal’ servers.

Read full topic

item.title: What's a 508?
item.dc:creator: @Dvs_Chick Dvs Chick
item.description:

item.title: What's a 508?
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

They have on other forums (No names). They may also be in the downloads section here.

There is a ipchanger 508 client aswell, which allows you to enter an ip of a server when you start the client up. Allowing you to connect to a server without having to edit and re-compile the source code.

Go exploring.

PS: No rep++, That is a dumb reason for Rep.

Read full topic

item.title: What's a 508?
item.dc:creator: @Dvs_Chick Dvs Chick
item.description:
@Dvs_Chick wrote:

How do I get a 508 client? And thanks for the help, I really appreciate it I would Rep++ if I could but I can’t :\

Read full topic

item.title: What's a 508?
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

The difference is newer Runescape land, items, objects, npcs.

Nothing special is required except a new 508 client and server. (No, you CANNOT use a 317 client on a 508 server)

Read full topic
